review_title: One of the better hospitals to work at in San Antonio.
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in San Antonio, TX
pros: Good staffing ratios, continuing educations, salary, and benefits.
cons: Can't complain. Better than most hospital systems in San Antonio, TX.
I do not see any cons
Sometimes it can be short staffed.

pros: I happened to work with a great team of nurses and my charge nurses were also great. Although I noticed when floating to other floors that wasn’t always the case.
cons:
Very stressful conditions. 
-Couldn’t find necessary equipment half the time. Ex. Need to complete a blood transfusion but cannot find an IV pump. 
-Not enough supporting staff (PCAs) to assist in providing quality patient care. Especially on nights we could be left with no PCA at all. 
-company encourages employee engagement but is not transparent with decision making or if any suggestions are even being considered. 
-unorganized systems 
-overall I felt I was unable to provide the kind of nursing care I would feel proud about and my mental health was suffering so I left

pros: Having a job? Nurses do their best with what they are given and work well as team. (Really no other choice in these conditions though)!
cons:
Horrible experience- Felt like a slave.
Management only looks out for company, not their nurses.
Pay is the worst for nurses in the area.
They cap your pay after so many years.
No overtime given anymore.
EVERYTHING is about HCAHPs not patient welfare!  (Money & greed!!)
Nurses leaving, sick, injured on job- the norm.
High patient load for nurses with little to no assistance from support staff (CNAs) because company refuses to hire any. 
Anything goes wrong and you are thrown under the bus by management. They won’t think twice about firing you to prove a point.
Broken equipment constantly.
Charge nurses who know little to nothing- or if they do- don’t offer assistance. So you’re basically on your own. 

Considering this company is run by HCA (the largest hospital corporation in the world) I’d say they have enough resources to treat their nurses with a bit more dignity.

review_title: It's an ok place to work
pros: People are super friendly, loved my coworkers!
cons: Equipment is out dated, management would send out texts to employees on their days off about things that could've easily been placed in an email, when transport wasn't there (happened frequently as they were always short) we had to go upstairs alone and get our own inhouse patients in big beds, minimal room for advancement, had different requests of per diems without any consistency (played favorites), made business into personal issues.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Nurses work together as a team
cons: Short staffed.Now required to do on call for endoscopy.Not what I was hired to do.Day surgery and endoscopy used to be separate departments

review_title: It’s a great place to work
pros: I love working in a supportive environment with great management.
cons: Some of the benefits could be improved upon.

pros:
Workers are very friendly.
